owner."},"pause(uint256)":{"details":"This function can only pause functionality, and thus cannot 'unflip' any bit in `_paused` from 1 to 0.","params":{"newPausedStatus":"represents the new value for `_paused` to take, which means it may flip several bits at once."}},"recordOvercommittedBeaconChainETH(address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Callable only by the podOwner's EigenPod contract.","params":{"amount":"The amount of beacon chain ETH to decrement from the podOwner's shares in the strategyManager.","podOwner":"The owner of the pod whose balance must be removed."}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"restakeBeaconChainETH(address,uint256)":{"details":"Callable only by the podOwner's EigenPod contract.","params":{"amount":"The amount of ETH to 'deposit' (i.e. be credited to the podOwner).","podOwner":"The owner of the pod whose balance must be deposited."}},"stake(bytes,bytes,bytes32)":{"params":{"depositDataRoot":"The root/hash of the deposit data for the validator's deposit.","pubkey":"The 48 bytes public key of the beacon chain validator.","signature":"The validator's signature of the deposit data."}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"unpause(uint256)":{"details":"This function can only unpause functionality, and thus cannot 'flip' any bit in `_paused` from 0 to 1.","params":{"newPausedStatus":"represents the new value for `_paused` to take, which means it may flip several bits at once."}},"updateBeaconChainOracle(address)":{"details":"Callable only by the owner of this contract (i.e. governance)","params":{"newBeaconChainOracle":"is the new oracle contract being pointed to"}},"withdrawRestakedBeaconChainETH(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Callable only by the StrategyManager contract.","params":{"amount":"The amount of ETH to withdraw.","podOwner":"The owner of the pod whose balance must be withdrawn.","recipient":"The recipient of the withdrawn ETH."}}},"stateVariables":{"__gap":{"details":"This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain. See https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/upgradeable#storage_gaps"},"beaconProxyBytecode":{"details":"Maintained as a constant to solve an edge case - changes to OpenZeppelin's BeaconProxy code should not cause addresses of EigenPods that are pre-computed with Create2 to change, even upon upgrading this contract, changing compiler version, etc."}},"title":"The contract used for creating and managing EigenPods","version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"BeaconChainETHDeposited(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted to notify a deposit of beacon chain ETH recorded in the strategy manager"},"BeaconOracleUpdated(address)":{"notice":"Emitted to notify the update of the beaconChainOracle address"},"Paused(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`, and changed to `newPausedStatus`."},"PodDeployed(address,address)":{"notice":"Emitted to notify the deployment of an EigenPod"},"Unpaused(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`, and changed to `newPausedStatus`."}},"kind":"user","methods":{"beaconChainOracle()":{"notice":"Oracle contract that provides updates to the beacon chain's state"},"createPod()":{"notice":"Creates an EigenPod for the sender."},"eigenPodBeacon()":{"notice":"Beacon proxy to which the EigenPods point"},"ethPOS()":{"notice":"The ETH2 Deposit Contract"},"getBeaconChainStateRoot(uint64)":{"notice":"Returns the Beacon Chain state root at `blockNumber`. Reverts if the Beacon Chain state root at `blockNumber` has not yet been finalized."},"getPod(address)":{"notice":"Returns the address of the `podOwner`'s EigenPod (whether it is deployed yet or not)."},"hasPod(address)":{"notice":"Returns 'true' if the `podOwner` has created an EigenPod, and 'false' otherwise."},"ownerToPod(address)":{"notice":"Pod owner to deployed EigenPod address"},"pause(uint256)":{"notice":"This function is used to pause an EigenLayer/DataLayer contract's functionality. It is permissioned to the `pauser` address, which is expected to be a low threshold multisig."},"pauseAll()":{"notice":"Alias for `pause(type(uint256).max)`."},"paused()":{"notice":"Returns the current paused status as a uint256."},"paused(uint8)":{"notice":"Returns 'true' if the `indexed`th bit of `_paused` is 1, and 'false' otherwise"},"pauserRegistry()":{"notice":"Address of the `PauserRegistry` contract that this contract defers to for determining access control (for pausing)."},"recordOvercommittedBeaconChainETH(address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Removes beacon chain ETH from EigenLayer on behalf of the owner of an EigenPod, when the         balance of a validator is lower than how much stake they have committed to EigenLayer"},"restakeBeaconChainETH(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Deposits/Restakes beacon chain ETH in EigenLayer on behalf of the owner of an EigenPod."},"slasher()":{"notice":"EigenLayer's Slasher contract"},"stake(bytes,bytes,bytes32)":{"notice":"Stakes for a new beacon chain validator on the sender's EigenPod.  Also creates an EigenPod for the sender if they don't have one already."},"strategyManager()":{"notice":"EigenLayer's StrategyManager contract"},"unpause(uint256)":{"notice":"This function is used to unpause an EigenLayer/DataLayercontract's functionality. It is permissioned to the `unpauser` address, which is expected to be a high threshold multisig or goverance contract."},"updateBeaconChainOracle(address)":{"notice":"Updates the oracle contract that provides the beacon chain state root"},"withdrawRestakedBeaconChainETH(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Withdraws ETH from an EigenPod. The ETH must have first been withdrawn from the beacon chain."}},"notice":"The main functionalities are: - creating EigenPods - staking for new validators on EigenPods - keeping track of the balances of all validators of EigenPods, and their stake in EigenLayer - withdrawing eth when withdrawals are createPod().details: Function will revert if the `msg.sender` already has an EigenPod.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pause(uint256).details: This function can only pause functionality, and thus cannot 'unflip' any bit in `_paused` from 1 to 0.

params.newPausedStatus: represents the new value for `_paused` to take, which means it may flip several bits at once.

recordOvercommittedBeaconChainETH(addres.details: Callable only by the podOwner's EigenPod contract.

params.amount: The amount of beacon chain ETH to decrement from the podOwner's shares in the strategyManager.
params.podOwner: The owner of the pod whose balance must be removed.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

restakeBeaconChainETH(address,uint256).details: Callable only by the podOwner's EigenPod contract.

params.amount: The amount of ETH to 'deposit' (i.e. be credited to the podOwner).
params.podOwner: The owner of the pod whose balance must be deposited.

params.depositDataRoot: The root/hash of the deposit data for the validator's deposit.
params.pubkey: The 48 bytes public key of the beacon chain validator.
params.signature: The validator's signature of the deposit data.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unpause(uint256).details: This function can only unpause functionality, and thus cannot 'flip' any bit in `_paused` from 0 to 1.

params.newPausedStatus: represents the new value for `_paused` to take, which means it may flip several bits at once.

updateBeaconChainOracle(address).details: Callable only by the owner of this contract (i.e. governance)

params.newBeaconChainOracle: is the new oracle contract being pointed to

withdrawRestakedBeaconChainETH(address,a.details: Callable only by the StrategyManager contract.

params.amount: The amount of ETH to withdraw.
params.podOwner: The owner of the pod whose balance must be withdrawn.
params.recipient: The recipient of the withdrawn ETH.

beaconChainOracle().notice: Oracle contract that provides updates to the beacon chain's state

createPod().notice: Creates an EigenPod for the sender.

eigenPodBeacon().notice: Beacon proxy to which the EigenPods point

getBeaconChainStateRoot(uint64).notice: Returns the Beacon Chain state root at `blockNumber`. Reverts if the Beacon Chain state root at `blockNumber` has not yet been finalized.

getPod(address).notice: Returns the address of the `podOwner`'s EigenPod (whether it is deployed yet or not).

hasPod(address).notice: Returns 'true' if the `podOwner` has created an EigenPod, and 'false' otherwise.

ownerToPod(address).notice: Pod owner to deployed EigenPod address

pause(uint256).notice: This function is used to pause an EigenLayer/DataLayer contract's functionality. It is permissioned to the `pauser` address, which is expected to be a low threshold multisig.

paused().notice: Returns the current paused status as a uint256.

paused(uint8).notice: Returns 'true' if the `indexed`th bit of `_paused` is 1, and 'false' otherwise

pauserRegistry().notice: Address of the `PauserRegistry` contract that this contract defers to for determining access control (for pausing).

recordOvercommittedBeaconChainETH(addres.notice: Removes beacon chain ETH from EigenLayer on behalf of the owner of an EigenPod, when the         balance of a validator is lower than how much stake they have committed to EigenLayer

restakeBeaconChainETH(address,uint256).notice: Deposits/Restakes beacon chain ETH in EigenLayer on behalf of the owner of an EigenPod.

stake(bytes,bytes,bytes32).notice: Stakes for a new beacon chain validator on the sender's EigenPod.  Also creates an EigenPod for the sender if they don't have one already.

unpause(uint256).notice: This function is used to unpause an EigenLayer/DataLayercontract's functionality. It is permissioned to the `unpauser` address, which is expected to be a high threshold multisig or goverance contract.

updateBeaconChainOracle(address).notice: Updates the oracle contract that provides the beacon chain state root

withdrawRestakedBeaconChainETH(address,a.notice: Withdraws ETH from an EigenPod. The ETH must have first been withdrawn from the beacon chain.

documentation.text: @notice The ETH2 Deposit Contract
@notice Beacon proxy to which the EigenPods point
@notice EigenLayer's StrategyManager contract
@notice EigenLayer's Slasher contract
@notice Oracle contract that provides updates to the beacon chain's state
@notice Pod owner to deployed EigenPod address
@notice Emitted to notify the update of the beaconChainOracle address
@notice Emitted to notify the deployment of an EigenPod
@notice Emitted to notify a deposit of beacon chain ETH recorded in the strategy manager

documentation.text: @notice Returns the Beacon Chain state root at `blockNumber`. Reverts if the Beacon Chain state root at `blockNumber` has not yet been finalized.
